data.name: Celebi & Venusaur-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Pollen Hazard
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Evergreen-GX
attacks.text: Heal all damage from this Pokémon. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Grass Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), shuffle all cards from your discard pile into your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Weedle
data.flavorText: Often found in forests and grasslands. It has a sharp, toxic barb of around two inches on top of its head.

attacks.name: Tangle Drag
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

data.name: Weedle
data.flavorText: Often found in forests and grasslands. It has a sharp, toxic barb of around two inches on top of its head.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Kakuna
data.flavorText: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself when it is in danger.

abilities.name: Grass Cushion
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Grass Energy attached to it, it takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Beedrill
data.flavorText: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.

attacks.name: Destiny Stinger
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if this Pokémon has any damage counters on it. Both Active Pokémon are Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Paras
data.flavorText: Whether it's due to a lack of moisture or a lack of nutrients, in Alola the mushrooms on Paras don't grow up quite right.

data.name: Parasect
data.flavorText: The bug is mostly dead, with the mushroom on its back having become the main body. If the mushroom comes off, the bug stops moving.

abilities.name: Panic Spores
abilities.text: Put 2 damage counters on your opponent's Confused Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Mysterious Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Pinsir
data.flavorText: It gets into territorial disputes with Vikavolt. For some reason, it apparently gets along well with Heracross in Alola.

attacks.name: Grip and Squeeze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Guillotine Hug
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out.

data.name: Exeggcute
data.flavorText: Six of them form a single Pokémon. Should one of the six be lost, the next morning there will once more be six.

attacks.name: Bullet Seed
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Charmander
data.flavorText: The flame on its tail indicates Charmander's life force. If it is healthy, the flame burns brightly.

attacks.name: Reprisal
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Shaymin ◇
data.flavorText: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.
rules: ◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

attacks.name: Flower Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage times the amount of basic Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.name: Charmander
data.flavorText: The flame on its tail indicates Charmander's life force. If it is healthy, the flame burns brightly.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Charmeleon
data.flavorText: It lashes about with its tail to knock down its foe. It then tears up the fallen opponent with sharp claws.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Charizard
data.flavorText: When expelling a blast of superhot fire, the red flame at the tip of its tail burns more intensely.

abilities.name: Roaring Resolve
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put 2 damage counters on this Pokémon. If you do, search your deck for up to 2 Fire Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Continuous Blaze Ball
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 50 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Ponyta
data.flavorText: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Rapidash
data.flavorText: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Vulpix
data.flavorText: Its beautiful tails have made it very popular. However, if it's not brushed diligently, it will be a mass of tangles before you know it.

attacks.name: Tail Whip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Ninetales
data.flavorText: It is vindictive and relentless by nature. Those who cross it even once will be cursed for a thousand years, along with their descendants.

abilities.name: Nine Temptations
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard 2 Fire Energy cards from your hand. If you do, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

data.name: Moltres
data.flavorText: It is said to be the legendary bird Pokémon of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flare of flames.

attacks.name: Top Burner
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy from this Pokémon. Then, discard a card from the top of your opponent's deck for each Energy you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Litten
data.flavorText: It doesn't allow its emotions to be easily seen. Earning its trust takes time. It prefers solitude.

attacks.name: Fasten Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Torracat
data.flavorText: It boasts powerful front legs. With a single punch, it can bend an iron bar right over.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Squirtle
data.flavorText: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

data.name: Squirtle
data.flavorText: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

abilities.name: Floating Shell
abilities.text: If you have a Stadium card in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

data.name: Wartortle
data.flavorText: When tapped, this Pokémon will pull in its head, but its tail will still stick out a little bit.

data.name: Blastoise
data.flavorText: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.

abilities.name: Powerful Squall
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 6 cards of your deck and attach any number of Water Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

attacks.name: Hydro Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Golduck
data.flavorText: Even fast-swimming fish Pokémon can be disabled by Golduck. It brings them to a standstill and seizes them.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Swim
attacks.text: If any of your opponent's Pokémon have any Water Energy attached to them, you may do 90 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon instead of their Active Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Staryu
data.flavorText: In many places, there are folktales of stardust falling into the ocean and becoming Staryu.

attacks.name: Numbing Water
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Psyduck
data.flavorText: Using psychokinesis gives it a headache, so it normally passes the time spacing out and doing as little as possible.

attacks.name: Headache
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Trainer cards from their hand during their next turn.

data.name: Magikarp
data.flavorText: In the distant past, they were fairly strong, but they have become gradually weaker over time.

attacks.name: Enter the Dragon
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put a card that evolves from this Pokémon from your discard pile onto this Pokémon to evolve it.

data.name: Gyarados
data.flavorText: It fires hyper beams in all directions, burning the surrounding area to ash. There are some regions where it's called "the deity of destruction."

attacks.name: Distilled Blast
attacks.text: Reveal the top 7 cards of your deck. This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Water Energy you find there. Then, shuffle those Energy cards back into your deck and discard the other cards.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Lapras
data.flavorText: It likes swimming around with people on its back. In the Alola region, it's an important means of transportation over water.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Articuno
data.flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon. It can create blizzards by freezing moisture in the air.

abilities.name: Blizzard Veil
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, whenever your opponent plays a Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to your Benched Water Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cold Cyclone
attacks.text: Move 2 Water Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Alolan Geodude
data.flavorText: If you mistake it for a rock and step on it, it will headbutt you in anger. In addition to the pain, it will also zap you with a shock.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Smash Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Alolan Geodude
data.flavorText: If you mistake it for a rock and step on it, it will headbutt you in anger. In addition to the pain, it will also zap you with a shock.

attacks.name: Self-Destruct
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 60 damage to itself.

data.name: Pikachu & Zekrom-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Full Blitz
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Tag Bolt-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Lightning Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Alolan Graveler
data.flavorText: When two Graveler fight each other, it fills the surroundings with flashes of light and sound. People call it the "fireworks of the earth."

data.name: Electrode
data.flavorText: It explodes in response to even minor stimuli. It is feared, with the nickname of "The Bomb Ball."

abilities.name: Electro Shaker
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may move any number of Lightning Energy from your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Alolan Golem
data.flavorText: It's grumpy and stubborn. If you upset it, it discharges electricity from the surface of its body and growls with a voice like thunder.

attacks.name: Electromagnetic Bomb
attacks.text: Move any number of Lightning Energy from your Benched Pokémon to this Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage for each Energy card you moved in this way.

attacks.name: Super Zap Cannon
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Voltorb
data.flavorText: It was discovered when Poké Balls were introduced. It is said that there is some connection.

data.name: Mareep
data.flavorText: It stores lots of air in its soft fur, allowing it to stay cool in summer and warm in winter.

attacks.name: Shock Bolt
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Zapdos
data.flavorText: A legendary Pokémon that is said to live in thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Thunderous Assault
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 70 more damage. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness.

data.name: Flaaffy
data.flavorText: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.

attacks.name: Shock Bolt
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Ampharos-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Power Recharge
attacks.text: Put all Electropower cards from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Impact Bolt
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Electrical-GX
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 7 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Blitzle
data.flavorText: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

attacks.name: Delivery Dash
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Electropower cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Zebstrika
data.flavorText: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

attacks.name: Raid
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Blitzle during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Emolga
data.flavorText: It grills berries and bug Pokémon with electric shocks and makes a meal of them. It usually nests in the holes gouged in trees by Pikipek.

abilities.name: Nuzzly Gathering
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Pokémon that has the Nuzzle attack, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Nuzzle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Joltik
data.flavorText: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Galvantula
data.flavorText: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.

abilities.name: Unnerve
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent plays an Item or Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spider Thread
attacks.text: Put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Helioptile
data.flavorText: The frills on either side of its head have cells that generate electricity when exposed to sunlight.

data.name: Heliolisk
data.flavorText: It stimulates its muscles with electricity, boosting the strength in its legs and enabling it to run 100 yards in five seconds.

attacks.name: Random Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Volt Switch
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Lightning Pokémon.

data.name: Tapu Koko ◇
data.flavorText: It confuses its enemies by flying too quickly for the eye to follow. It has a hair-trigger temper but forgets what made it angry an instant later.
rules: ◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

abilities.name: Dance of the Ancients
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may choose 2 of your Benched Pokémon and attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to each of them. If you do, discard all cards from this Pokémon and put it in the Lost Zone.

data.name: Zeraora
data.flavorText: It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack, they'll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Gengar & Mimikyu-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Poltergeist
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. This attack does 50 damage for each Trainer card you find there.

attacks.name: Horror House-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any cards from their hand during their next turn. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Psychic Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), each player draws cards until they have 7 cards in their hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Nidoran ♀
data.flavorText: Although small, its venomous barbs render this Pokémon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Nidorina
data.flavorText: The female has a gentle temperament. It emits ultrasonic cries that have the power to befuddle foes.

attacks.name: Family Rescue
attacks.text: Shuffle 5 Psychic Pokémon from your discard pile into your deck.

data.name: Nidorino
data.flavorText: It raises its big ears to check its surroundings. If it senses anything, it attacks immediately.

data.name: Nidoran ♂
data.flavorText: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.

data.name: Nidoqueen
data.flavorText: It uses its scaly, rugged body to seal the entrance of its nest and protect its young from predators.

abilities.name: Queen's Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Pokémon that isn't a Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Power Lariat
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Evolution Pokémon on your Bench.

data.name: Nidoking
data.flavorText: It is recognized by its rock-hard hide and its extended horn. Be careful with the horn, as it contains venom.

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: King's Drum
attacks.text: If Nidoqueen is on your Bench, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Tentacool
data.flavorText: It drifts through the sea searching for prey. Its poisonous tentacles break off sometimes, but after a while, they grow back.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Grimer
data.flavorText: It was born from sludge on the ocean floor. In a sterile environment, the germs within its body can't multiply, and it dies.

data.name: Tentacruel
data.flavorText: It fires off ultrasonic waves from its red orbs to weaken its prey, and then it wraps them up in its 80 tentacles.

attacks.name: Void Tentacles
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Paranormal
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Ultra Beasts.

data.name: Muk
data.flavorText: Their food sources have decreased, and their numbers have declined sharply. Sludge ponds are being built to prevent their extinction.

abilities.name: Poison Sacs
abilities.text: The Special Condition Poisoned is not removed when your opponent's Pokémon evolve or devolve.

attacks.name: Toxic Secretion
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

data.name: Alolan Marowak
data.flavorText: Its custom is to mourn its lost companions. Mounds of dirt by the side of the road mark the graves of the Marowak.

attacks.name: Limbo Limbo
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Alolan Club
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Pokémon in play that has Alolan in its name.

data.name: Starmie
data.flavorText: Its sparkling core is called "the gem of the sea." This core can be made into high-priced accessories that are traded in secret.

attacks.name: Strange Wave
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 in any combination of Water and Psychic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Mr. Mime
data.flavorText: Its pantomime skills are wonderful. You may become enraptured while watching it, but next thing you know, Mr. Mime has made a real wall.

abilities.name: Scoop-Up Block
abilities.text: Your opponent's Pokémon that have any damage counters on them, and any cards attached to those Pokémon, can't be put into your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Cosmog
data.flavorText: In ages past, it was called the child of the stars. It's said to be a Pokémon from another world, but no specific details are known.

abilities.name: Cosmic Guard
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

data.name: Mr. Mime-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Magic Odds
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by your opponent's attacks if that damage is exactly 10, 30, 50, 70, 90, 110, 130, 150, 170, 190, 210, 230, or 250.

attacks.name: Breakdown
attacks.text: For each card in your opponent's hand, put 1 damage counter on their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Life Trick-GX
attacks.text: Heal all damage from this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Jynx
data.flavorText: It sways its hips to a rhythm all its own. The precise movements of Jynx living in Alola are truly wonderful.

attacks.name: Dazzle Dance
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Mysterious Dance
attacks.text: For each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Cosmoem
data.flavorText: There's something accumulating around the black core within its hard shell. People think this Pokémon may come from another world.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Hitmonlee
data.flavorText: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.

attacks.name: Special Combo
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if your Hitmonchan used Hit and Run during your last turn. This attack does 90 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Mankey
data.flavorText: The smallest of things could cause it to lose its temper. Because it doesn't hold in its stress, this Pokémon can live a long time.

attacks.name: Scout
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

data.name: Primeape
data.flavorText: It will never forgive opponents who have angered it. Even after it has beaten them down until they can't move, it never ever forgives.

attacks.name: Wreck
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 80 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.

data.name: Hitmonchan
data.flavorText: The arm-twisting punches it throws pulverize even concrete. It rests after three minutes of fighting.

attacks.name: Hit and Run
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Omanyte
data.flavorText: Omanyte lived in the seas of antiquity. Its fossils have been found bearing bite marks from Archeops, so apparently Archeops preyed on it.

attacks.name: Tickle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Kabuto
data.flavorText: This Pokémon thrived 300 million years ago. It's said that living specimens can still be seen in a certain region—a rare sight.

attacks.name: Ramming Shell
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Omastar
data.flavorText: Its heavy shell is thought to be the reason this ancient Pokémon died out. It's apparently a distant ancestor of Octillery.

abilities.name: Fossil Bind
abilities.text: As long as you have fewer Pokémon in play than your opponent, they can't play any Item cards from their hand.

data.name: Kabutops
data.flavorText: Its body had begun to change so it could function on land. But it didn't adapt in time and went extinct.

abilities.name: Fossilized Memories
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Supporter cards from their hand.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Larvitar
data.flavorText: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.

attacks.name: Chip Away
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Pupitar
data.flavorText: Its shell is as hard as sheet rock, and it is also very strong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.

attacks.name: Payback
attacks.text: If your opponent has exactly 1 Prize card remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Pancham
data.flavorText: There's no point to the leaf in its mouth, aside from an effort to look cool. It's mischievous, so it's not well suited to inexperienced Trainers.

attacks.name: Arm Thrust
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Lycanroc-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Twilight Eyes
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Splintered Shards-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Energy card in your opponent's discard pile. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Alolan Muk
data.flavorText: While it's unexpectedly quiet and friendly, if it's not fed any trash for a while, it will smash its Trainer's furnishings and eat up the fragments.

abilities.name: Adventurous Appetite
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may look at the top 6 cards of your opponent's deck and discard any number of Item cards you find there. Your opponent shuffles the other cards back into their deck.

attacks.name: Gunk Shot
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Alolan Grimer
data.flavorText: The crystals on Grimer's body are lumps of toxins. If one falls off, lethal poisons leak out.

attacks.name: Chemical Breath
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Special Condition affecting your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Tyranitar
data.flavorText: If it rampages, it knocks down mountains and buries rivers. Maps must be redrawn afterward.

attacks.name: Spinning Tail
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Bite Off
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-GX or a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Poochyena
data.flavorText: It has a very tenacious nature. Its acute sense of smell lets it chase a chosen prey without ever losing track.

attacks.name: Howl in the Dark
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Darkness Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Mightyena
data.flavorText: It chases down prey in a pack of around ten. They defeat foes with perfectly coordinated teamwork.

attacks.name: Dark Fang
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

data.name: Zoroark
data.flavorText: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.

attacks.name: Taunt
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Night Punishment
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile. You can't do more than 200 damage in this way.

data.name: Absol
data.flavorText: Although it's said to bring disaster, in actuality, this Pokémon possesses a calm disposition and warns people of any crises that loom.

abilities.name: Dark Ambition
abilities.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, its Retreat Cost is Colorless more.

attacks.name: Shadow Seeker
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.name: Spiritomb
data.flavorText: It was bound to a fissure in an odd keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago

attacks.name: Spirit Compressor
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 4 Pokémon and discard them. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Zorua
data.flavorText: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hide in Shadows
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Vullaby
data.flavorText: It can't fly yet and must wait until its wings have developed more. Since it's still at a playful age, it hops around friskily.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Pangoro
data.flavorText: From the slight twitches of its bamboo leaf, it deduces its opponent's movements. It's eager to tussle but kindhearted toward its companions.

attacks.name: Tighten Up
attacks.text: Your opponent discards 2 cards from their hand.

attacks.name: Tantrum
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Mandibuzz
data.flavorText: It circles in the sky, keeping a keen eye out for Pokémon in a weakened state. Its choicest food is Cubone.

attacks.name: Trash Crash
attacks.text: Discard an Item card from your hand. If you do, this attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Brave Bird
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Hoopa-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rogue Ring
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Dark Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Dark Strike during your next turn.

attacks.name: Devilish Hands-GX
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX 6 times. (You can choose the same Pokémon more than once.) For each time you chose a Pokémon, do 30 damage to it. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Incineroar-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Scar Charge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put 3 damage counters on this Pokémon. If you do, search your deck for up to 3 Darkness Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Crushing Punch
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Darkest Tornado-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Bronzor
data.flavorText: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.

abilities.name: Evolutionary Advantage
abilities.text: If you go second, this Pokémon can evolve during your first turn.

data.name: Yveltal
data.flavorText: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

attacks.name: Derail
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Skarmory
data.flavorText: Its metal body is sturdy, but it does rust rather easily. So on rainy days, this Pokémon prefers to stay put in its nest.

attacks.name: Calm Strike
attacks.text: If you have used your GX attack, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Steel Wing
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Jirachi
data.flavorText: It is said to have the ability to grant any wish for just one week every thousand years.

abilities.name: Stellar Wish
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may look at the top 5 cards of your deck, reveal a Trainer card you find there, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle the other cards back into your deck, and this Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Bronzong
data.flavorText: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.

abilities.name: Heatproof
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Fire Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shady Stamp
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Ferroseed
data.flavorText: It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.name: Ferrothorn
data.flavorText: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Thorn Pod Throw
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. You can't do more than 100 damage to a Benched Pokémon in this way. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Bisharp
data.flavorText: Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard. Then Bisharp finishes off the prey.

attacks.name: Single Lunge
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has no damage counters on it, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Honedge
data.flavorText: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person's arm and drains that person's life energy completely.

attacks.name: Cut Down
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Doublade
data.flavorText: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.

attacks.name: Tool Drop
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Pokémon Tool card attached to all Pokémon.

data.name: Cobalion-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Metal Symbol
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon that has any Metal Energy attached to it can't be affected by any Special Conditions. Remove any Special Conditions affecting those Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dueling Saber
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Iron Rule-GX
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, their Pokémon can't attack. (This includes Pokémon that come into play on that turn.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Pawniard
data.flavorText: Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking the blades that cover their bodies into their prey.

attacks.name: Rigidify
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Aegislash
data.flavorText: Apparently, it can detect the innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.

abilities.name: Royal Guard
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 40 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Shield Bash
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Klefki
data.flavorText: It never lets go of a key that it likes, so people give it the keys to vaults and safes as a way to prevent crime.

abilities.name: Key of Secrets
abilities.text: Each of your Metal Pokémon's Resistance is now -40.

data.name: Alolan Ninetales
data.flavorText: It creates drops of ice in its coat and showers them over its enemies. Anyone who angers it will be frozen stiff in an instant.

abilities.name: Luminous Barrier
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX.

data.name: Mimikyu
data.flavorText: Its actual appearance is unknown. A scholar who saw what was under its rag was overwhelmed by terror and died from the shock.

attacks.name: Filch
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Copycat
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon used an attack that isn't a GX attack during their last turn, use it as this attack.

data.name: Latias & Latios-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Buster Purge
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aero Unit-GX
attacks.text: Attach 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to it during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Alolan Exeggutor
data.flavorText: As it grew taller and taller, it outgrew its reliance on psychic powers, while within it awakened the power of the sleeping dragon.

attacks.name: Tropical Shake
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each type of basic Energy card in your discard pile. You can't add more than 100 damage in this way.

data.name: Dragonair
data.flavorText: Lakes where Dragonair live are filled with offerings from people, because they believe this Pokémon is able to control the weather.

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Dratini
data.flavorText: It's still weak, so it lurks on the floor of bodies of water, eating whatever food sinks down and living a quiet life.

attacks.name: Dragon Rage
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Dratini
data.flavorText: It's still weak, so it lurks on the floor of bodies of water, eating whatever food sinks down and living a quiet life.

abilities.name: Defensive Scales
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Eevee & Snorlax-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cheer Up
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dump Truck Press
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 120 more damage.

attacks.name: Megaton Friends-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), draw cards until you have 10 cards in your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Alolan Exeggutor
data.flavorText: Exeggutor is the pride of the Alolan people. Its image is carved into historical buildings and murals.

attacks.name: Paradise Draw
attacks.text: You may discard any number of cards from your hand. Then, draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Egg Splat
attacks.text: Discard any number of Exeggcute from your hand. This attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Dragonite
data.flavorText: It flies over raging seas as if they were nothing. Observing this, a ship's captain dubbed this Pokémon "the sea incarnate."

abilities.name: Fast Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Pidgey
data.flavorText: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Pidgeotto
data.flavorText: The claws on its feet are well developed. It can carry prey such as an Exeggcute to its nest over 60 miles away.

abilities.name: Air Mail
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Put the other card on the bottom of your deck.

data.name: Pidgeot
data.flavorText: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spin Storm
attacks.text: Your opponent puts their Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into their hand.

data.name: Meowth
data.flavorText: When visiting a junkyard, you may catch sight of it having an intense fight with Murkrow over shiny objects.

data.name: Pidgey
data.flavorText: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Persian
data.flavorText: Although the jewel on its forehead appears to be a different color than those of Alolan Persian, it's mostly made of the same material.

attacks.name: Make 'Em Pay
attacks.text: If your opponent has 4 or more cards in their hand, they reveal their hand. Discard cards you find there until your opponent has exactly 4 cards in their hand.

attacks.name: Sharp Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Tauros
data.flavorText: They live in groups. The one with the longest, thickest, and most-scarred horns is the boss of the herd.

attacks.name: Raging Herd
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on all of your Tauros and Tauros-GX.

data.name: Farfetch'd
data.flavorText: The plant stalk it holds is its weapon. The stalk is used like a sword to cut all sorts of things.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Tool Buster
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tool cards from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If you discarded a Pokémon Tool card in this way, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Kangaskhan
data.flavorText: Kangaskhan protects its child by keeping it in its pouch. It has zero forgiveness for those who harm its child and will beat them down.

attacks.name: Fast Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Evolution Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Lugia
data.flavorText: It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is rumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.

attacks.name: Power Charger
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Zangoose
data.flavorText: Its fur would all stand on end if it smelled a Seviper nearby. Its sharp claws tear up its foes.

attacks.name: Head Hunt
attacks.text: Look at the top 6 cards of your deck, reveal any number of Pokémon you find there, and put them into your hand. Discard the other cards.

data.name: Bill's Analysis
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal up to 2 Trainer cards you find there and put them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Black Market ◇
rules: When a Darkness Pokémon (yours or your opponent's) that has any Darkness Energy attached to it is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, that player takes 1 fewer Prize card.
Whenever any player plays an Item or Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to this Stadium card.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

data.name: Buff Padding
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to has a Retreat Cost of exactly 4, it gets +50 HP.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Dana
rules: You can play this card only if your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Stage 2 Pokémon.
Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Aerodactyl
data.flavorText: Restored from DNA found in amber, this Pokémon exhibited ferocity that was greater than expected. Some casualties resulted.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Fossil Fangs
attacks.text: If you don't have any Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX on your Bench, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Brock's Grit
rules: Shuffle 6 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Evelyn
rules: You can play this card only if your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Stage 1 Pokémon.
Draw 4 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lavender Town
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may have their opponent reveal their hand.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Ingo & Emmet
rules:
Look at the top card of your deck, and then choose 1:
• Discard your hand and draw 5 cards.
• Discard your hand and draw 5 cards from the bottom of your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Jasmine
rules: Search your deck for a Metal Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you go second and it's your first turn, search for 5 Metal Pokémon instead of 1. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Judge Whistle
rules:
Choose 1:
• Draw a card
• Put a Judge card from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Pokémon Communication
rules: Reveal a Pokémon from your hand and put it into your deck. If you do, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Return Label
rules: Put a card from your opponent's discard pile on the bottom of their deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Electrocharger
rules: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, shuffle an Electropower card from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Erika's Hospitality
rules: You can play this card only if you have 4 or fewer other cards in your hand.
Draw a card for each of your opponent's Pokémon in play.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Grass Memory
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Silvally-GX this card is attached to is a Grass Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Metal Goggles
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.

The Metal Pokémon this card is attached to takes 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance), and your opponent's attacks and Abilities can't put damage counters on it.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Pokémon Communication
rules: Reveal a Pokémon from your hand and put it into your deck. If you do, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Sabrina's Suggestion
rules: Your opponent reveals their hand. You may choose a Supporter card you find there and use the effect of that card as the effect of this card.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Morgan
rules: You can play this card only if you discard Dana, Evelyn, and Nita from your hand.
Look at the top 12 cards of your deck and attach any number of Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Nanu
rules: Choose a Basic Darkness Pokémon in your discard pile. Switch it with 1 of your Pokémon in play. Any attached cards, damage counters, Special Conditions, turns in play, and any other effects remain on the new Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Nita
rules: You can play this card only if your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon.
Put an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon on top of their deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Pokémon Communication
rules: Reveal a Pokémon from your hand and put it into your deck. If you do, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Evergreen-GX
attacks.text: Heal all damage from this Pokémon. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Grass Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), shuffle all cards from your discard pile into your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Viridian Forest
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may discard a card from their hand. If they do, that player searches their deck for a basic Energy card, reveals it, and puts it into their hand. Then, that player shuffles their deck.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Fairy Charm UB

data.name: Unidentified Fossil

data.name: Metal Goggles
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.

The Metal Pokémon this card is attached to takes 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance), and your opponent's attacks and Abilities can't put damage counters on it.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
